Questions.QuestionString: Engine oil system is ventilated at? (Level 1)
The aerodynamic station #2.5 locates at: (Level 1)
How is thrust reverser fully deployed indicated? (Level 1)
Answers: REV in amber appears inside the N1 gauge.
REV in green appears inside the N1 gauge.
REV in green appears inside the N2 gauge.

Questions.QuestionString: What is the protection for N2 overlimit? (Level 3)
Answers: There is no protection, the Thrust lever must be moved aftward manually
There is an electrical and a mechanical protection
There is a mechanical protection to close more the Bypass valve

Questions.QuestionString: Which condition required to open the HPSOV? (Level 3)
Answers: Commanded fuel pressure from the FMV.

Questions.QuestionString: When open, where does the VBV direct airflow? (Level 1)
The fuel used indication is reset to zero: (Level 1)
Answers: Five minutes after engine shut down

Questions.QuestionString: What is the indications in case of metallic parts in the common scavenge oil pipe? (Level 1)
Answers: Only a popped clogging visual indication
A low oil pressure indication and warning

Questions.QuestionString: In case of ECU channel input loss, what happens? (Level 1)
Answers: Switch over to the other channel
The channel in control uses values from the other channel
The channel in control uses default values.

Questions.QuestionString: Fluids drained from the power plant are? (Level 1)
How does the starter operate? (Level 1)
What controls the engine in all operating regimes? (Level 1)
How many bearing compartments does the engine have? (Level 1)
During engine start in manual mode, ignition systems A and B are shown on ecam: (Level 2)
Answers: It means that either system A or B has failed
It means that both systems A and B failed
This is normal. A and B are selected in manual start

Questions.QuestionString: How many blades in one engine fan set; (Level 1)
How many stages does the HPC have: (Level 1)
How many stages does the HPT have: (Level 1)
Which computer controls the engine thrust: (Level 1)
An output fault in one channel of ECU causes: (Level 3)
Answers: system to go to the designed failed safe position
switch over to control from the other channel
affected channel to generate an another output signal

Questions.QuestionString: The operating servo pressure in the VSV system is: (Level 3)
The A320/321 engines throttle control levers can: (Level 1)
What shaft does the air starter rotate? (Level 1)
What happen in case the main filter on the lubrication line is clogged  (Level 3)
Answers: The by-pass valve opens, half of the oil flow passes through the main filter, and the other part through the back up filter
A red warning is triggered, oil temperature increases
The engine page appears on ECAM oil passes through the by pass valve, back up filter and to the bearings

Questions.QuestionString: Engine oil heat exchanger is on? (Level 1)
Which important safety procedure should be performed before any maintenance work on or near the ‘C’ ducts or reverser system? (Level 3)
Answers: Deactivate and pin the lever on the HCU.

Questions.QuestionString: The engine parameters sent directly to the ECAM by the Electronic Control Unit (ECU), are: (Level 2)
With engine running, continuous ignition can be selected via the ECU: (Level 2)
Answers: manually using the ENG/MODE/CRANK/NORM/IGN/START selector switch to IGN/START

Questions.QuestionString: What is the purpose of compressor airflow control? (Level 2)
Answers: To limit compressor surge and to provide good acceleration
To control the bypass compressor airflow
To control the bleed air used for pneumatic system

Questions.QuestionString: The aerodynamic station #25 locates at: (Level 2)
What is true regarding to the VBV? (Level 3)
Answers: The VBV actuator is powered by servo fuel.
The VBV actuator is pneumatically operated by P3.
The VBV is actuated by gear motor.

Questions.QuestionString: Fluids drained from the pylon are? (Level 1)
During engine start sequence, how does the starter operate? (Level 2)
What is the engine type currently installed on VNA A320s A/C? (Level 3)
For CFM56-5B/P, the fan cowl is equipped with: (Level 1)
For CFM56-5B/P, the thrust reverser cowl is equipped with: (Level 2)
For CFM56-5B/P, how many fan blades are there? (Level 2)
For CFM56-5B/P, the thrust reverser cowl doors are opened: (Level 2)
Answers: Electrically by a motor or manually and secured by a hold open rod.
Hydraulically or manually and secured by a hold open rod.
Hydraulically and secured by a hold open rod.

Questions.QuestionString: For CFM56-5B/P, to support the thrust reverser cowls: (Level 3)
Answers: Two hold open rods are used for each thrust reverser cowl door.
One hold open rod is used for each thrust reverser cowl door.
One rod supports both thrust reverser cowl doors at the same time.

Questions.QuestionString: The CFM56-5B/P LP rotor (N1) is made of (Level 2)
Answers: The fan and the booster compressor driven by the five stage LP turbine.
Four stage compressor driven by a two stage turbine.
Fan and a four-stage compressor driven by a four stage turbine.

Questions.QuestionString: The CFM56-5B/P HP (N2) rotor is made of (Level 2)
Answers: 9-stage compressor driven by a single stage turbine.
10-stage HP compressor driven by a 2-stage HP turbine.
12-stage compressor driven by a single stage turbine.

Questions.QuestionString: For CFM56-5B/P, what bearings support the HP rotor? (Level 2)
The forward mount: (Level 2)
Answers: Carries the engine torque, thrust and side loads.
Carries the engine torque, vertical and side loads.
Carries the engine thrust, vertical and side loads.

Questions.QuestionString: The aft mount: (Level 2)
Answers: Carries the engine torque, thrust and side loads.
Carries the engine torque, vertical and side loads.
Carries the engine thrust, vertical and side loads.

Questions.QuestionString: The FADEC automatically selects a continuous relight: (Level 2)
Answers: In case of Engine Interface Unit (EIU) failure only.
If engine anti-icing is detected ON or EIU failure or engine flame-out.
In case of Electronic Control Unit (ECU) failure only.

Questions.QuestionString: What is the purpose of the ENGINE MASTER SWITCH? (Level 3)
Answers: To open or close the HP fuel Shut-Off Valve.
To command and reset the FADEC functions.
Both to open or close the HP fuel Shut-Off Valve and to command and reset the FADEC functions.

Questions.QuestionString: The ENGine MANual START push buttons to operate the corresponding start valves in (Level 2)
Answers: the manual start mode or during an engine cranking.

Questions.QuestionString: During an engine manual start, "AB" ignition indication on the ECAM: (Level 2)
Answers: Means that ignition systems A and B have failed.
Means that system A has failed but system B is operational.
Is the normal indication for an engine manual start.

Questions.QuestionString: The purpose of the LP and HP turbine clearance control systems is to: (Level 2)
Answers: Reduce wear of the turbine blades.

Questions.QuestionString: The compressor airflow control of the CMF56-5B/P includes (Level 2)
Answers: a Variable Bleed Valve (VBV) system and a Variable Stator Vane (VSV) system.
a BSBV system, a VSV system and bleed valves at the 7th and 10th stages of the HPC.
a booster stage bleed valve system and a Variable Stator Vane (VSV) system.

Questions.QuestionString: Where is the servo fuel for the fuel operated actuators supplied from? (Level 2)
How many igniter plugs and exciter boxes are fitted in the combustion system? (Level 2)
Which area of the inlet cowl has ice protection? (Level 3)
Answers: The inlet cowl lip or “D” section
There is no ice protection thanks to aerodynamic design of the engine.
The inner barrel of inlet cowl

Questions.QuestionString: In case of P2/T2 probe heating failure during engine operation, the affected engine will operate in: (Level 3)
Has the pressure filter a bypass valve fitted in the oil system? (Level 2)
What is the purpose of an auto re-stow system if available? (Level 3)
Answers: To stow the thrust reverser when the thrust control lever at idle reverse position.

Questions.QuestionString: Approximately at what speed does the starter air valve (SAV) close during a start sequence? (Level 1)
What senses movement of the T/R translating sleeve? (Level 1)
Answers: The LVDT’s on the upper actuators.
The proximity switches on the locking actuators.
The LVDT’s on the lower actuators.

Questions.QuestionString: Prior to performing maintenance on the thrust reverser: (Level 1)
Answers: The yellow hydraulic system must be depressurized.
Deactivate the thrust reverser by placing the lever in the inhibition position on the Hydraulic Control Unit (HCU).
Deactivate the thrust reverser by disconnecting the hydraulic supply lines.

Questions.QuestionString: The ENG FADEC GND PWR is used to: (Level 3)
Answers: Enable the pilots to start the engines automatically.
Supply the computers dedicated to the engines when the engines are not running.
Enable the pilots to start the engines manually.

Questions.QuestionString: The aerodynamic station Nº3 is: (Level 1)
EGT is picked up at (Level 1)
What are the primary parameters displayed on the EWD? (Level 1)
Answers: N1, N2, EGT, N1 and N2 Vibration

Questions.QuestionString: Which valve ensures the adequate fuel flow to the nozzles? (Level 1)
What does the master chip detector do in case of metal particules detection? (Level 1)
Answers: It sends a signal to the ECU
It provides a warning to the ECAM system.
It operates a visual indicator for ground inspection.

Questions.QuestionString: What happens if one of the latches is not unlocked during the reverse operation? (Level 2)
Answers: The three other doors are deployed.
The other latches are hyd. relocked.

Questions.QuestionString: When the throttle lever is between two detent points what position correspond to the thrust limit? (Level 3)
THE THRUST OF CFM56-5B4 ON VNA’S A320 AIRCRAFT FLEET IS: (Level 3)
Where is the access panel to starter valve? (Level 2)
Answers: On the left fan cowl door.
Both fan cowl doors need to be opened.

Questions.QuestionString: The fan cowl is equipped with: (Level 2)
What turbine engine section provides for proper mixing of the fuel and air? (Level 2)
What bearings support the LP rotor? (Level 2)
The engine thrust indicated on ECAM via what parameter? (Level 2)
The LPTACC system uses(Level 2)
Answers: Fan discharge air for LPT case cooling
Booster discharge air for LPT case cooling
HPT discharge air for LPT case cooling

Questions.QuestionString: The oil tank content can be checked by? (Level 2)
Answers: Opening a dedicated servicing access panel in the LH fan cowl.
Opening an access panel on the LH “C’ duct.

Questions.QuestionString: What does the pressure detector indicate to the ECU? (Level 2)
Select the correct type of combustion chamber for CFM-56-5B4 engine? (Level 2)
How is the thrust reverser controlled? (Level 2)
Answers: By the ECU and the two conditions from Spoiler Elevator Computers and EIU inhibition relay

Questions.QuestionString: Each thrust reverser "C" duct is opened by : (Level 1)
The drains are located: (Level 1)
Answers: At the rear part of pylon

Questions.QuestionString: When the throttle lever is between two detents, the thrust rating limit correspoends to : (Level 2)
When deploy blocker door manually. What is correct? (Level 2)
Answers: All of blocker doors at a time.
Each blocker door deploy independently but must follow the sequence.

Questions.QuestionString: Engine control unit is supplied by a dedicated generator on the engine: (Level 2)
Answers: When the start sequence is completed
If the aircraft is in flight

Questions.QuestionString: The HPTCC system operation (Level 2)
Answers: Uses 5th and 9th stage HPC bleed air
Has 3 modes of control, mixed failsafe and off

Questions.QuestionString: The handcranking pad is located: (Level 2)
Answers: On the front face of  main gearbox ( Forward looking aft )
On the rear face of  main gearbox ( Forward looking aft )

Questions.QuestionString: Of which type is the ignition system? (Level 2)
What is the function of the HCU de-activation lever? (Level 2)
Answers: Mechanically prevents operation of the Pressurization Valve.
Mechanically prevents movement of the Directional Control Valve.
Inhibits operation of the hydraulic pressure switch.

Questions.QuestionString: Is the L.P. compressor bleed valve (VBV)? (Level 2)
Ignition systems are controlled by: (Level 2)
Answers: Electronic Control Unit (ECU) in automatic start mode.
Electronic Control Unit (ECU) in automatic and manual start mode.
Engine Interface Unit (EIU) in automatic and manual start mode.

Questions.QuestionString: Thrust rating of the engine CFM56-5B41 is: (Level 2)
To replace the engine you need to   (Level 3)
Answers: Open the thrust reverser cowls at 35 degrees position.
Open the thrust reverser cowls at 45 degrees position.
Open the thrust reverser cowls at 55 degrees position.

Questions.QuestionString: How many bolts connects FWD ENGINE MOUNT to the PYLON  (Level 3)
What happen in automatic start when N2 reached 43%?  (Level 3)
Answers: MAN start P/B ON light goes off.

Questions.QuestionString: The cowling assembly consists of : (Level 3)
Answers: The air intake cowl, the fan cowl, the thrust reverser cowl and the primary exhaust (primary nozzle and center body)
The air intake cowl, the fan cowl, the thrust reverser cowl and the common nozzle assembly.
The air intake cowl, the fan cowl, the thrust reverser cowl and the center body.

Questions.QuestionString: Which cowls incorporate a lightning protection system? (Level 3)
Answers: Fan cowl and thrust reverser cowl
Inlet cowl, fan cowl and thrust reverser cowl.

Questions.QuestionString: The fan cowl hold open rods are: (Level 3)
Answers: Telescopic type with fixed open position at 40 degree.
Telescopic type with 2 positions: 40 degree for routine maintenance and 55 degree for increased access. (ME Repair, E&A Repair)
Telescopic type with 3 positions: 30 degree for routine maintenance, 40 degree for ECU removal access and 55 degree for increased access.

Questions.QuestionString: What is one of the major structural and aerodynamic components of the engine?(ME Repair) (Level 3)
The engine is attached to the pylon by (ME Repair, E&A Repair) (Level 3)
The FAN cowl door is held in position by: (ME Repair, E&A Repair) (Level 3)
Each thrust reverser “C” duct is opened by: (ME Repair, E&A Repair) (Level 3)
The power plant drain system is located: (ME Repair, E&A Repair) (Level 3)
Answers: At the rear part of pylon

Questions.QuestionString: For CFM56, the fan cowl is equipped with: (ME Repair, E&A Repair) (Level 3)
For CFM56, the thrust reverser cowl is equipped with: (ME Repair, E&A Repair) (Level 3)
Can be replacement engine with the air intake cowl installed?(ME Repair) (Level 3)
Answers: Yes, Engine can be replacement with or without the air intake cowl installed.
No, Engine cannot replacement with the air intake cowl installed.
No, Engine only can be replacement without the air intake cowl installed.
